Description: Terracotta figure rattle in the form of a pig (?). Handmade; modelled snout and ears, curved back, flat underside with four short rounded legs. Red brown Nile silt with mica and organic inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallels from Kamiros, Rhodes (Jacopi 1930, 289, fig. 319). This is a local copy of an East Greek type. A similar rattle, in the form of a hedgehog, was also found at Naukratis ( Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1886.511; see also Bolton 1886.31.58.f) and another at Corinth dated to the early 5th century BC (Frankfurt Museum, Bol and Kotera 1986, 63, no. 33). Bol, P. C., Kotera, E. 1986, Bildwerke aus Terrakotta aus mykenischer bis römischer Zeit. Liebieghaus-Museum alter Plastik Antike Bildwerke III, Melsungen. Jacopi, G. 1930. Esplorazione archeologica di Camiro I. Clara Rhodos IV. Scavi Nelle Necropoli Camiresi 1929-1930.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.316) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4533 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
